results.title: Advanced science: vacuum practice
results.brief_description: The concept of vacuum and the application of high vacuum techniques. The pressure of a gas; various types of vacuum pumps; instruments for measuring degrees of vacuum; high vacuum techniques as applied in electronics, manufactures, metallurgy, pharmacy, the electron microscope and the apparatus of nuclear research.
results.description: The concept of vacuum and the application of high vacuum techniques. results.title: Advanced science: the spectrograph
results.creator_credit: World Wide Pictures and Morag MacLennan
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the nature and principles of the spectrograph by natural photography and by animated diagram. Illustrates the use of the spectrograph in qualitative and quantitative detection of impurities; in biological research in criminology; and in astronomy.
results.description: Demonstrates the nature and principles of the spectrograph by natural photography and by animated diagram. Illustrates the use of the spectrograph in qualitative and quantitative detection of impurities; in biological research in criminology; and in astronomy.

results.title: Advanced science: isotopes
results.brief_description: This film describes the nature and production of isotopes; radio-active isotopes and their use in industry and medicine. Shows natural uranium being separated into isotopes; uses lithium as an example to explain the meaning of isotopes; history of their discovery; methods of separating isotopes, and the making of radio-isotopes and their uses are illustrated.
results.description: This film describes the nature and production of isotopes; radio-active isotopes and their use in industry and medicine. results.title: Advanced passenger train: a selection of recent shots
results.brief_description: An insight into British Railways Advanced Passenger Train, showing the work being done in research and testing for this new generation of rail vehicle including the “E” and “POP” trains. The train will be powered by gas turbine engines and will have a host of revolutionary ideas such as hydro-kinetic braking, swinging arm suspension for curves.

results.title: Advanced passenger train
results.brief_description: Gives an insight into British Rail’s Experimental Advanced Passenger Train powered by gas turbines and with a host of revolutionary ideas such as a tilting system to stabilise the train at speed on sharp curves and hydro-kinetic braking.
results.description: Gives an insight into British Rail’s Experimental Advanced Passenger Train powered by gas turbines and with a host of revolutionary ideas such as a tilting system to stabilise the train at speed on sharp curves and hydro-kinetic braking.

results.brief_description: Several people who learnt to read in adulthood, through the B.B.C. ‘On the way’ program, explain what difference doing so has made to them.

results.title: Adriana Lecouvreur
results.creator_credit: Opera Australia, ABC-TV (Australia), John Copley and Hugh Davidson
results.brief_description: Recorded live at the Sydney Opera House on 18 February 1984 this performance of Francesco Cilea’s ” Adriana Lecouvreur” features the grand voice of Dame Joan Sutherland, along with John Shaw, Anson Austin and Heather Begg, The Australian Opera Chorus and The Elizabethan Sydney Orchestra conducted by Richard Bonynge. Set in four acts, it tells the tragic story of a Parisian actress, Adriana Lecouvreur. “This is an excellently sung, played and staged production of this lovely, lyrical opera”…(The Canberra Times). Sung in Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Adorable Menteuse = Such an Adorable Liar
results.brief_description:
Juliette and Sophie share an apartment. Juliette is a garrulous 18-year-old girl who can’t go five minutes without telling a lie. She spies on her upstairs neighbour, a man of 40, pretending she is in love with him … until the day she really is. She vows to reform and speak nothing but the truth. But her reputation precedes her and her gentleman friend refuses to take anything she says seriously.

Credits: Producer, Philippe Dussart ; director, Michel Deville ; writers, Nina Companeez, Michel Deville ; photography, Claude Lecomte ; music, Jean Dalve.
Cast: Marina Vlady, Macha Meril, Ginette Letondal, Jean-Marc Bory, Michel Vitold, Jean-Francois Calve, Claude Nicot, Michel Lonsdale, Christian Alers.
